result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor Mitchell Rhodes

records.addlTxt:
10:39 AM Defendant Taylor Mitchell Rhodes in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Defendant wants to get an Attorney but he doesn't qualify for Public Defender.  Court advises the defendant to fill out court appointed Attorney paperwork.

Recess

11:00am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Court questions the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not eligible for a court appointed attorney and denies the request.
Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:28 PM Defendant Taylor Mitchell Rhodes appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for PD appointment.  

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 
Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 

Court confirms address and phone.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
